s.text: A young black man is more likely to be a mugger than a young white man--but the assumption that any particular young black man is a mugger will usually be wrong.
Profiling means a police officer using cumulative knowledge and training to identify certain indicators of possible criminal activity.
Profiling means a police officer using cumulative knowledge and training to identify certain indicators of possible criminal activity.
When he spied a white couple strolling toward him arm in arm, he would walk directly at them, at a normal pace.
On the other hand, race is not just any proxy, and probably should be used more sparingly--especially by the government--than the narrow logic of probabilities would justify.
On the other hand, race is not just any proxy, and probably should be used more sparingly--especially by the government--than the narrow logic of probabilities would justify.

When you fear a man approaching you may be a mugger, you may not be able to find out in the next five seconds whether he happens to be a University of Chicago intellectual headed for the New York Times editorial board.
And if the implied generalization had no validity--if a young black male was no more likely to be a mugger than anyone else approaching on the sidewalk--it would be easy to label as racist.
And if the implied generalization had no validity--if a young black male was no more likely to be a mugger than anyone else approaching on the sidewalk--it would be easy to label as racist.
And if the implied generalization had no validity--if a young black male was no more likely to be a mugger than anyone else approaching on the sidewalk--it would be easy to label as racist.
And if the implied generalization had no validity--if a young black male was no more likely to be a mugger than anyone else approaching on the sidewalk--it would be easy to label as racist.
And if the implied generalization had no validity--if a young black male was no more likely to be a mugger than anyone else approaching on the sidewalk--it would be easy to label as racist.

If the clouds turn dark and ominous and it starts to thunder while you're out for a stroll, you can find a phone and call the weather service, or you can ignore them on the grounds that predictions about the weather are often wrong, or you can take cover under the assumption that it's probably going to rain.
If skin color as a proxy for criminal intentions were a precise tool--that is, if every young black man strolling the sidewalks were a mugger--it would be hard to criticize.

When you fear a man approaching you may be a mugger, you may not be able to find out in the next five seconds whether he happens to be a University of Chicago intellectual headed for the New York Times editorial board.
